GraphNode Tensor Exceptions

Specified below are strict tests covering the exception behavior of the GraphNode class interacting with Tsr instances.

features.id: A tensor cannot be deleted if it is part of a graph and the tensor is used as derivative.

blocks.text: A new simple scalar tensor instance.
A GraphNode mock object which is being added to the tensor.
We try to delete the tensor...
The graph node object will return true for "isUsedAsDerivative()" inside the tensor...

code: exception.message == "Cannot delete a tensor which is used as derivative by the AD computation graph!"

blocks.text: The exception message is also being thrown.
code: 1 * System.err.println({it.endsWith("Cannot delete a tensor which is used as derivative by the AD computation graph!")})
